meanings.definition: A portion of land or revenue granted by a sovereign as a privilege or for support.
meanings.sent1: The apanages given to the nobles helped them maintain their status.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, apanages were often granted to loyal knights.
meanings.sent3: The king jokingly promised his cat an apanage of the best sleeping spot in the castle.
meanings.sent4: The apanages distributed among the lords were like pieces of a puzzle forming the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The apanages were like golden keys unlocking the doors to power and influence.

meanings.definition: An inherited or assigned right or privilege.
meanings.sent1: The family heirloom was considered an apanage passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: She cherished the apanages of freedom and independence bestowed upon her.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully argued over the apanage of choosing the movie for the night.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was an apanage that endeared him to all who knew him.
meanings.sent5: The apanages of knowledge and wisdom were treasured above all else.
